titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Ella went off to London by the 8.20 express. The Macdonalds departed after breakfast.
I wrote a short letter to the 'Times' calling attention to the centenary of Robertson's birth
. Then I worked away at the sermon for S. Margaret's next Sunday morning. I walked with the Bishop of Jarrow after lunch: attended Evensong: and wrote many letters.
